item.title: Organic pastoral paradise at Dikencik Cottages
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
After spending a day on over-crowded Oludeniz Beach (spectacular as it is, a beach covered in loungers, inflatable pool toys and cafes is not my idea of holiday bliss) and getting lost in the fish ‘n chip shop flanked streets of the hideous tourist town of Hisaronu, it was with great relief when our little […]

item.title: Escaping the crowds on Turkey’s Turquoise Coast
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In two weeks of travelling in Turkey, I marvelled at some pretty spectacular vistas, from the minaret-encrusted skyline of Istanbul to panoramas over Cappadocia on a hot air balloon ride. The pinnacle of my viewing pleasure came at the end of a Â tiny winding road through a countryside seemingly devoid of tourism: hamlets of a […]

item.title: 10 things I loved about magical Cappadocia
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
I didn’t know what to expect Cappadocia. All I knew before visiting this famous region of Turkey (pronounced cappa-doe-kiya, as I subsequently discovered) was that there were caves that you could stay in, the hot air ballooning was pretty good and there were fairy chimneys made out of rock . I arrived after an hour’s […]

The post 10 things I loved about magical Cappadocia appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: A hobbit’s cave fantasy
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Hezen Cave Hotel made me want to become a troglodyte if it meant that I could live in one of their cave suites (rather than the damp, dark, musty, cold algae-covered hovels I’d always associated with the word ‘cave’). With a massive lounge area, sleek glass-walled bathroom, huge airy bedroom and funky, bright modern-retro decor […]

The post A hobbit’s cave fantasy appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: The world’s best breakfasts
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
I’m a breakfast person and one of my favourite things about foodie travel is discovering what different countries serve on the table in the mornings. I love America’s fluffy pancakes smothered in maple syrup, India’s masala dosa, France’s pain au chocolat, Italy’s cappuccino-pastry combo and Taiwan’s cong you bing jia dan (a spring onion pancake […]

The post The world’s best breakfasts appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Luxury cave living in Cappadocia
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
What most excited me about visiting Cappadocia, in central Turkey, other than hot air ballooning over fairy chimneys with a hundred other balloons littering the sky, was the prospect of staying in a cave hotel. Cappadocia’s landscape is covered in surreal volcanic rock towers, gorges, villages with rock castles perched above them, and thousands of […]
